results.title: Letters to Ali [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lunar Films, Eddie L.C. Fong and Clara Law
results.brief_description: Remarkable work, that is part road-movie, about an Australian family who befriend an Afghanistan refugee (via letters), held in Port Hedland, their relationship with him and their attempts to free him. Clara Law (Goddess of 1967) accompanies the family on a 12,000 kilometre round trip taken to visit Ali, exploring the dynamics of the family and laying bare the cruel bureaucracy of the Australian government that holds refugees in detention centres for limitless periods, under dire conditions. A ponderous and significant work that contains moments of beauty whilst conveying the pain and anguish of all involved. Also available on VHS [318951].

results.title: Letters home
results.brief_description: Sue’s great grandfather, Elisha Morgan, fought in the American Civil War but today all the family has left are three photographs, some letters, an obituary and a sword.

results.title: Letters from Poland: Sydney, November, 1950
results.brief_description:
In Sydney in 1950 a young Polish woman waits for the arrival of Tadek, her prospective husband. Working as a night cleaner in a city office, she strikes up a casual friendship with the nightwatchman and waits for Tadek.
Cast features Martin Vaughan. Photography and editing by Martha Ansara.

results.title: Letters from Poland
results.creator_credit: Mark Stiles, AFTRS and Sophia Turkiewicz
results.brief_description: The story of a young Polish immigrant and her struggle to build a new life in the harsh environment of post World War II Sydney. The film raises a number of themes: the loneliness of being in a foreign land; the special isolation of a migrant woman and the dislocation of a single mother needing to support both herself and her child. Cast includes Bashia Bonkowski, Martin Vaughan, Jessica O’Donnell, Arthur Krawczynski, Tracy Ellis. Photography: Martha Ansara

results.title: Letterpress printing
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Letterpress printing in which a raised inked pattern is pressed on to a prepared surface requires the work of several trades. Follows the work from linotype operator to typesetter and the final “makeready”. Also shows processes for photographic blockmaking.

results.title: Letterboxes: the inside story
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Catherine South
results.brief_description: An engaging and humorous look at the significance of the letterbox in urban life. The letterboxes we see are of all different shapes and sizes. Their owners tell why they chose them and the impact the mail delivery has on their daily lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Catherine South

results.title: Letter writing at work
results.brief_description: Often the impression conveyed in a letter is very different from the one intended, and the message is muddled and confusing. This can be disastrous when a letter is written at work, or when it is sent on behalf of a company or other organisation. The film is intended to be shown to clerks, office supervisors and managers, in fact for everyone who has to write letters during their working day. It sets out to show that there is no secret art to writing effective business letters, but that there are some basic rules which can be followed in almost every case.

results.title: Letter to Santa
results.creator_credit: Davis Film and Video Production, John Davis and Ursula Kolbe
results.brief_description: An enchanting puppet story about a country which is desperately short of water. Sally writes to Santa, saying that she will forgo presents this year if he can only make it rain. Santa builds a giant snowball and tows it behind his sleigh all the way to Australia but the snowball is too heavy.

results.title: Letter to Brezhnev
results.creator_credit: Janet Goddard, Channel Four Films and Chris Bernard
results.brief_description: A movie about the craziest, most lovable teenagers to come out of Liverpool since the Beatles. It’s a fairytale full of edgy cynical realism. It’s a love story and an adventure with a rock ‘n’ roll soundtrack. It’s a movie about inner-city decay, the frustration of unemployment and people desperate for change - any change. This film has gathered an impressive array of awards and critical praise but its most impressive achievement is evident by its popularity amongst audiences. Starring Peter Firth and features music from Bronski Beat.
